00066 // CONFIGURATION SETTINGS
00067 #include "generic_processorConfigBits.h"        // Provided for ease-of-development. 
00068                                                 // Should not be used in an actual 
00069                                                 // application.
00070 
00071     // TIP: Valid configuration bit labels can be found in Hi-Tech's folder.
00072     //      C:\Program Files\HI-TECH Software<COMPILER NAME><VERSION NUMBER>\include
00073     //      Open the 'pic' header file that corresponds to your microcontroller.
00074     //      Ex: 'pic16f1937.h'  --  NOT 'as16f1937.h' or 'cas16f1937.h'

00078     void interrupt  ISR                 (void);

00080 // START PROGRAM
00081 void main(void)
00082 {
00083     Example_System_Init();          // Your System Initialization Function
00084 
00085     
00086     //================================================================================================
00087     //  ____                  _              _           _____                _          _    ____ ___ 
00088     // |  _ \ ___  __ _ _   _(_)_ __ ___  __| |  _ __ __|_   _|__  _   _  ___| |__      / \  |  _ \_ _|
00089     // | |_) / _ \/ _` | | | | | '__/ _ \/ _` | | '_ ` _ \| |/ _ \| | | |/ __| '_ \    / _ \ | |_) | | 
00090     // |  _ <  __/ (_| | |_| | | | |  __/ (_| | | | | | | | | (_) | |_| | (__| | | |  / ___ \|  __/| | 
00091     // |_| \_\___|\__, |\__,_|_|_|  \___|\__,_| |_| |_| |_|_|\___/ \__,_|\___|_| |_| /_/   \_\_|  |___|
00092     //               |_|                    
00093     //================================================================================================                                                           
00094     
00095     mTouch_Init();                  // mTouch Initialization (Required)
00096     
00097     #if defined(MCOMM_ENABLED)
00098     mComm_Init();
00099     #endif
00100       
00101     INTCONbits.GIE = 1;             // Initialization complete. Begin servicing interrupts.
00102     
00103     while(1)
00104     {    
00105     
00106         if (mTouch_isDataReady())   // Is new information ready?
00107         {
00108             mTouch_Service();       // Decode the newly captured data and transmit new data updates.
00109 
00110     //------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00111     //                              REQUIRED MTOUCH API ENDS HERE
00112     //
00113     // NOTE: The below API examples show some possible ways to integrate your application with
00114     //       the mTouch framework. These are not required, but may be helpful.
00115     //------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00116     
00117     
00118             //  ____                              ____  _        _            _    ____ ___ 
00119             // / ___|  ___ _ __  ___  ___  _ __  / ___|| |_ __ _| |_ ___     / \  |  _ \_ _|
00120             // \___ \ / _ \ '_ \/ __|/ _ \| '__| \___ \| __/ _` | __/ _ \   / _ \ | |_) | | 
00121             //  ___) |  __/ | | \__ \ (_) | |     ___) | || (_| | ||  __/  / ___ \|  __/| | 
00122             // |____/ \___|_| |_|___/\___/|_|    |____/ \__\__,_|\__\___| /_/   \_\_|  |___| 
00123             
00124             // The mTouch framework does not have an automated, board-level output system. 
00125             // All system responses to sensor state changes must be programmed by you, as shown below.
00126 
00127             #define LED_ON  0
00128             #define LED_OFF 1
00129             
00130             #define LED0  LATC2
00131             #define LED1  LATC1
00132             #define LED2  LATC0
00133             #define LED3  LATA7
00134             #define LED4  LATA6
00135             #define LED5  LATA4
00136             #define LED6  LATD7
00137             #define LED7  LATD6
00138             #define LED8  LATD5
00139             #define LED9  LATD4
00140             #define LED10 LATD3
00141             #define LED11 LATD2
00142             #define LED12 LATD1
00143             #define LED13 LATD0
00144 
00145             
00146             // #define LED0 RA2
00147             // #define LED1 RA3            
00148             
00149             // #define LED0 GP1
00150             // #define LED1 GP2
00151             
00152             // Example of a sensor's output being directed to an I/O pin
00153             //
00154             // Ex:  (User presses)  LED turns on.
00155             //      (User releases) LED turns off.
00156             //      etc.
00157             
00158             
00159             // if (mTouch_GetButtonState(0) < MTOUCH_PRESSED) { LED0 = LED_OFF; } else { LED0 = LED_ON; } // Sensor0
00160             // if (mTouch_GetButtonState(1) < MTOUCH_PRESSED) { LED1 = LED_OFF; } else { LED1 = LED_ON; } // Sensor1
00161             // if (mTouch_GetButtonState(2) < MTOUCH_PRESSED) { LED2 = LED_OFF; } else { LED2 = LED_ON; } // Sensor2
00162             // if (mTouch_GetButtonState(3) < MTOUCH_PRESSED) { LED3 = LED_OFF; } else { LED3 = LED_ON; } // Sensor3
00163             // if (mTouch_GetButtonState(4) < MTOUCH_PRESSED) { LED4 = LED_OFF; } else { LED4 = LED_ON; } // Sensor4
00164             // if (mTouch_GetButtonState(5) < MTOUCH_PRESSED) { LED5 = LED_OFF; } else { LED5 = LED_ON; } // Sensor5
00165             // if (mTouch_GetButtonState(6) < MTOUCH_PRESSED) { LED6 = LED_OFF; } else { LED6 = LED_ON; } // Sensor6
00166             // if (mTouch_GetButtonState(7) < MTOUCH_PRESSED) { LED7 = LED_OFF; } else { LED7 = LED_ON; } // Sensor7
00167                 
00168 
00169             //  _____                 _           _    ____ ___ 
00170             // |_   _|__   __ _  __ _| | ___     / \  |  _ \_ _|
00171             //   | |/ _ \ / _` |/ _` | |/ _ \   / _ \ | |_) | | 
00172             //   | | (_) | (_| | (_| | |  __/  / ___ \|  __/| | 
00173             //   |_|\___/ \__, |\__, |_|\___| /_/   \_\_|  |___|
00174             //            |___/ |___/                       
00175                         
00176             // Example of a sensor using the toggle latch. This is a memory-efficient toggle implementation
00177             // that will alternate between on and off each time the sensor is pressed.
00178             //
00179             // Ex:  (User presses)  LED turns on. 
00180             //      (User releases) LED remains on. 
00181             //      (User presses)  LED turns off.
00182             //      (User releases) LED remains off.
00183             //      (User presses)  LED turns on.
00184             //      etc
00185             
00186             #if defined(MTOUCH_TOGGLE_ENABLED)
00187             if (mTouch_GetToggleState(0) == MTOUCH_TOGGLE_OFF) { LED0 = LED_OFF; } else { LED0 = LED_ON; }
00188             #endif
00189             
00190             
00191             //  ____  _ _     _                _    ____ ___ 
00192             // / ___|| (_) __| | ___ _ __     / \  |  _ \_ _|
00193             // \___ \| | |/ _` |/ _ \ '__|   / _ \ | |_) | | 
00194             //  ___) | | | (_| |  __/ |     / ___ \|  __/| | 
00195             // |____/|_|_|\__,_|\___|_|    /_/   \_\_|  |___|
00196              
00197             // Example slider output code
00198             #if defined(MTOUCH_SLIDERS_ENABLED)
00199             #if defined(MTOUCH_SLIDER_SCALING_ENABLED)
00200                 
00201                 // Scaling Enabled: mTouch_GetSlider(i) returns a value between 0 and 255.
00202                 #define NUMBER_OF_SLIDER_LED_OUTPUT     8
00203                 
00204                 #if     (NUMBER_OF_SLIDER_LED_OUTPUT ==  8)     // 8-LED Slider Output Example :: 9 distinct slider output values
00205                     if (mTouch_GetSlider(0) >= 28)  { LED0 = LED_ON; } else { LED0 = LED_OFF; }
00206                     if (mTouch_GetSlider(0) >= 57)  { LED1 = LED_ON; } else { LED1 = LED_OFF; }
00207                     if (mTouch_GetSlider(0) >= 85)  { LED2 = LED_ON; } else { LED2 = LED_OFF; }
00208                     if (mTouch_GetSlider(0) >= 114) { LED3 = LED_ON; } else { LED3 = LED_OFF; }
00209                     if (mTouch_GetSlider(0) >= 142) { LED4 = LED_ON; } else { LED4 = LED_OFF; }
00210                     if (mTouch_GetSlider(0) >= 170) { LED5 = LED_ON; } else { LED5 = LED_OFF; }
00211                     if (mTouch_GetSlider(0) >= 199) { LED6 = LED_ON; } else { LED6 = LED_OFF; }
00212                     if (mTouch_GetSlider(0) >= 227) { LED7 = LED_ON; } else { LED7 = LED_OFF; }
00213                 #elif   (NUMBER_OF_SLIDER_LED_OUTPUT ==  4)     // 4-LED Slider Output Example :: 5 distinct slider output values
00214                     if (mTouch_GetSlider(0) >= 51)   { LED0 = LED_ON; } else { LED0 = LED_OFF; }
00215                     if (mTouch_GetSlider(0) >= 102)  { LED1 = LED_ON; } else { LED1 = LED_OFF; }
00216                     if (mTouch_GetSlider(0) >= 153)  { LED2 = LED_ON; } else { LED2 = LED_OFF; }
00217                     if (mTouch_GetSlider(0) >= 204)  { LED3 = LED_ON; } else { LED3 = LED_OFF; }
00218                 #endif
00219                 
00220             #else
00221             
00222                 // Scaling Disabled: mTouch_GetSlider(0) returns a value between 0 and MTOUCH_SLIDER0_MAX_VALUE.
00223                 
00224                     #define MTOUCH_SLIDER0_MAX_VALUE     ((MTOUCH_NUMBER_SLIDER0_SENSORS - 1) * 256)
00225                     if (mTouch_GetSlider(0) >= (uint16_t)( 1/9 * MTOUCH_SLIDER0_MAX_VALUE)) { LED0 = LED_ON; } else { LED0 = LED_OFF; }
00226                     if (mTouch_GetSlider(0) >= (uint16_t)( 2/9 * MTOUCH_SLIDER0_MAX_VALUE)) { LED1 = LED_ON; } else { LED1 = LED_OFF; }
00227                     if (mTouch_GetSlider(0) >= (uint16_t)( 3/9 * MTOUCH_SLIDER0_MAX_VALUE)) { LED2 = LED_ON; } else { LED2 = LED_OFF; }
00228                     if (mTouch_GetSlider(0) >= (uint16_t)( 4/9 * MTOUCH_SLIDER0_MAX_VALUE)) { LED3 = LED_ON; } else { LED3 = LED_OFF; }
00229                     if (mTouch_GetSlider(0) >= (uint16_t)( 5/9 * MTOUCH_SLIDER0_MAX_VALUE)) { LED4 = LED_ON; } else { LED4 = LED_OFF; }
00230                     if (mTouch_GetSlider(0) >= (uint16_t)( 6/9 * MTOUCH_SLIDER0_MAX_VALUE)) { LED5 = LED_ON; } else { LED5 = LED_OFF; }
00231                     if (mTouch_GetSlider(0) >= (uint16_t)( 7/9 * MTOUCH_SLIDER0_MAX_VALUE)) { LED6 = LED_ON; } else { LED6 = LED_OFF; }
00232                     if (mTouch_GetSlider(0) >= (uint16_t)( 8/9 * MTOUCH_SLIDER0_MAX_VALUE)) { LED7 = LED_ON; } else { LED7 = LED_OFF; }
00233                     // NOTE: This is an example of a slider using 8 LEDs to display its current value.
00234                     //       By defining it like this, the number of sensors in slider 0 can be adjusted 
00235                     //       without changing how the slider's output is displayed.
00236             #endif
00237             #endif
00238             
00239             
00240             //  __  __       _        _           _    ____ ___ 
00241             // |  \/  | __ _| |_ _ __(_)_  __    / \  |  _ \_ _|
00242             // | |\/| |/ _` | __| '__| \ \/ /   / _ \ | |_) | | 
00243             // | |  | | (_| | |_| |  | |>  <   / ___ \|  __/| | 
00244             // |_|  |_|\__,_|\__|_|  |_/_/\_\ /_/   \_\_|  |___|
00245             // Example matrix output code for a 3x4 Matrix
00246 
00247             #if defined(MTOUCH_MATRIX_ENABLED)  
00248                 if (mTouch_Matrix_hasChanged())         // If the matrix value has changed since last time
00249                 {
00250                     mTouch_Matrix_latchNewValue();      // Save the new value of the matrix
00251                     
00252                     LED1  = LED_OFF;                    // Reset all matrix outputs
00253                     LED2  = LED_OFF;
00254                     LED3  = LED_OFF;
00255                     LED4  = LED_OFF;
00256                     LED5  = LED_OFF;
00257                     LED6  = LED_OFF;
00258                     LED7  = LED_OFF;
00259                     LED8  = LED_OFF;
00260                     LED9  = LED_OFF;
00261                     LED10 = LED_OFF;
00262                     LED11 = LED_OFF;
00263                     LED12 = LED_OFF;
00264                 }
00265 
00266                 if (mTouch_Matrix_isPressed())          // If the matrix is being pressed
00267                 {
00268                     switch(mTouch_Matrix_getRow())      // Find the row/column being pressed and output accordingly.
00269                     {
00270                         case 0:                         
00271                             switch(mTouch_Matrix_getColumn())
00272                             {
00273                                 case 0: LED1  = LED_ON; break;  // (0, 0)
00274                                 case 1: LED2  = LED_ON; break;  // (0, 1)
00275                                 case 2: LED3  = LED_ON; break;  // (0, 2)
00276                                 case 3: LED4  = LED_ON; break;  // (0, 3)
00277                             }
00278                             break;
00279                         case 1:
00280                             switch(mTouch_Matrix_getColumn())
00281                             {
00282                                 case 0: LED5  = LED_ON; break;  // (1, 0)
00283                                 case 1: LED6  = LED_ON; break;  // (1, 1)
00284                                 case 2: LED7  = LED_ON; break;  // (1, 2)
00285                                 case 3: LED8  = LED_ON; break;  // (1, 3)
00286                             }
00287                             break;
00288                         case 2:
00289                             switch(mTouch_Matrix_getColumn())
00290                             {
00291                                 case 0: LED9  = LED_ON; break;  // (2, 0)
00292                                 case 1: LED10 = LED_ON; break;  // (2, 1)
00293                                 case 2: LED11 = LED_ON; break;  // (2, 2)
00294                                 case 3: LED12 = LED_ON; break;  // (2, 3)
00295                             }
00296                             break;
00297                     }
00298                 }
00299             #endif
00300             
00301             //  __  __           _           _    ____ ___ 
00302             // |  \/  | ___   __| | ___     / \  |  _ \_ _|
00303             // | |\/| |/ _ \ / _` |/ _ \   / _ \ | |_) | | 
00304             // | |  | | (_) | (_| |  __/  / ___ \|  __/| | 
00305             // |_|  |_|\___/ \__,_|\___| /_/   \_\_|  |___|
00306             // 
00307             // Modes allow for different sensors to be read in different application states.
00308             //
00309             // IMPORTANT NOTE:
00310             //  The logic, below, assumes debouncing is set to 0. If debouncing is higher
00311             //  than this, the state of the sensors will be checked before their state has
00312             //  had an opportunity to update itself. 
00313             //
00314             // This is just one way in which the mode switching may be implemented.
00315             
00316             
00317             #if MTOUCH_NUM_MODES > 1
00318         
00319             mTouch_DisableScanning();   // Temporarily disable scanning while this logic completes
00320             
00321             // Are all of the current sensors initialized? If not, stay in the current mode and keep scanning until 
00322             // they are. mTouch_state.areInitialized is a single-bit reserved for making temporary, local checks 
00323             // such as this.
00324             mTouch_state.areInitialized = 1;
00325             
00326             if (mTouch_GetButtonState(0) == MTOUCH_INITIALIZING) {   mTouch_state.areInitialized = 0;    }
00327             #if (MTOUCH_NUMBER_SENSORS > 1)        
00328             if (mTouch_GetButtonState(1) == MTOUCH_INITIALIZING) {   mTouch_state.areInitialized = 0;    }
00329             #endif
00330             #if (MTOUCH_NUMBER_SENSORS > 2)        
00331             if (mTouch_GetButtonState(2) == MTOUCH_INITIALIZING) {   mTouch_state.areInitialized = 0;    }
00332             #endif
00333             
00334             if (mTouch_state.areInitialized && !mTouch_state.skippedDecode)
00335             {
00336                 if (mTouch_modeIndex == 0)
00337                 {
00338                     if (mTouch_GetButtonState(1) == MTOUCH_PRESSED)
00339                     {
00340                         mTouch_ChangeMode(1);
00341                     }
00342                 }
00343                 else if (mTouch_modeIndex == 1)
00344                 {
00345                     #if defined(MCOMM_ENABLED) && defined(MCOMM_UART_HARDWARE_USED) 
00346                                                         // If we are outputting data using a hardware UART...
00347                         while(MCOMM_UART_TXIF == 0);    // Finish all communications before entering sleep
00348                     #endif
00349                     
00350                     //PIC_SWDTEN_ON();                  // If using a software-enabled WDT, enable it now.
00351                     //SLEEP();                          // Sleep, if you want to.
00352                     //NOP();                            // One more instruction is executed before sleeping.
00353                     
00354                     if (mTouch_GetButtonState(0) == MTOUCH_PRESSED)
00355                     {
00356                         mTouch_ChangeMode(0);
00357                     }
00358                     
00359                     //PIC_SWDTEN_OFF();
00360                 }
00361             }
00362             mTouch_EnableScanning();    // Re-enable scanning
00363             #endif
00364             
00365         } // end - mTouch_isDataReady() check
00366         
00367         
00368         
00369         //  _____                       ____       _            _   _                  _    ____ ___ 
00370         // | ____|_ __ _ __ ___  _ __  |  _ \  ___| |_ ___  ___| |_(_) ___  _ __      / \  |  _ \_ _|
00371         // |  _| | '__| '__/ _ \| '__| | | | |/ _ \ __/ _ \/ __| __| |/ _ \| '_ \    / _ \ | |_) | | 
00372         // | |___| |  | | | (_) | |    | |_| |  __/ ||  __/ (__| |_| | (_) | | | |  / ___ \|  __/| | 
00373         // |_____|_|  |_|  \___/|_|    |____/ \___|\__\___|\___|\__|_|\___/|_| |_| /_/   \_\_|  |___|
00374         
00375         // Checks whether any sensors are shorted to VDD or VSS
00376         #if defined(MTOUCH_ERROR_DETECTION_ENABLED)
00377         mTouch_ErrorDetect();
00378         if (mTouch_state.error)
00379         {
00380             // Perform action to notify the user of error.
00381         }
00382         #endif
00383         
00384 
00385         
00386     } // end - while(1) main loop
00387 } // end - main() function
00388

00394 // | |___ >  < (_| | | | | | | |_) | |  __/  ___) | |_| \__ \ ||  __/ | | | | |  | || | | | | |_ 
00395 // |_____/_/\_\__,_|_| |_| |_| .__/|_|\___| |____/ \__, |___/\__\___|_| |_| |_| |___|_| |_|_|\__|
00396 //                           |_|                   |___/                          
00397 //================================================================================================               
00398 
00399 void Example_System_Init() 
00400 {
00401     // The mTouch framework controls these modules:
00402     // *  TMR0  - YOU MUST INIT THE OPTION REGISTER / TMR0 PRESCALER
00403     //            Do not choose 1:1 prescaling.
00404     //
00405     // *  ADC   - automatic initialization
00406     // *  UART  - automatic initialization (if enabled and available)
00407     //
00408     // mTouch performs better as Fosc increases.    
00409     
00410     // NOTE: Update the configuration file if Fosc is changed!
00411     #if defined(_PIC14E)
00412         #if     _XTAL_FREQ == 32000000
00413         OSCCON  = 0b01110000;       // 32 MHz Fosc w/ PLLEN_ON (config bit)  
00414         #elif   _XTAL_FREQ == 16000000
00415         OSCCON  = 0b01111000;       // 16 MHz (PLLEN config bit doesn't matter)
00416         #endif
00417     #elif defined(_PIC18)
00418         OSCCONbits.IRCF = 7;        // 8 MHz
00419     #endif
00420     
00421     
00422     // EXAMPLE PORT INITIALIZATION
00423     //
00424     // mTouch sensor pins should be initialized as digital, output low.
00425     #if   defined(_16F1937)
00426     ANSELA      = 0b00000000;       
00427     ANSELB      = 0b00000000;       
00428     ANSELD      = 0b00000000;
00429     ANSELE      = 0b00000000;
00430     TRISA       = 0b00000000;
00431     TRISB       = 0b00000000;
00432     TRISC       = 0b00000000;
00433     TRISD       = 0b00000000;
00434     TRISE       = 0b00000000;
00435     PORTA       = 0b11011110;    
00436     PORTB       = 0b00000000;    
00437     PORTC       = 0b10100111;    
00438     PORTD       = 0b11111111;    
00439     PORTE       = 0b00000111; 
00440     #endif
00441     
00442     // EXAMPLE TIMER INITIALIZATIONS   
00443     //
00444     // Only an 8-bit timer may be used as the mTouch framework timer. 
00445     // TMR1/3/5 are not currently able to be used for this purpose.
00446     #if defined(MTOUCH_ISR_TIMER)
00447     #if (MTOUCH_ISR_TIMER == 0)
00448         #if defined(_PIC18)
00449         T0CON       = 0b11000000;   // TMR0 is 8-bit. Prescaler = 1:2
00450         #else
00451         OPTION_REG  = 0b10000000;   // TMR0 Prescaler  = 1:2
00452         #endif
00453     #elif (MTOUCH_ISR_TIMER == 2)
00454         T2CON       = 0b00001100;   // TMR2 Postscaler = 1:2
00455         PR2         = 0xFF;
00456     #elif (MTOUCH_ISR_TIMER == 4)
00457         T4CON       = 0b00001100;   // TMR4 Postscaler = 1:2
00458         PR4         = 0xFF;
00459     #elif (MTOUCH_ISR_TIMER == 6)
00460         T6CON       = 0b00001100;   // TMR6 Postscaler = 1:2
00461         PR6         = 0xFF;
00462     #endif
00463     #endif
00464 }
00465 
00466 
00467 //================================================================================================
00468 //  _____                           _        ___ ____  ____  
00469 // | ____|_  ____ _ _ __ ___  _ __ | | ___  |_ _/ ___||  _ \ 
00470 // |  _| \ \/ / _` | '_ ` _ \| '_ \| |/ _ \  | |\___ \| |_) |
00471 // | |___ >  < (_| | | | | | | |_) | |  __/  | | ___) |  _ < 
00472 // |_____/_/\_\__,_|_| |_| |_| .__/|_|\___| |___|____/|_| \_\
00473 //                           |_|                                                                                     
00474 //================================================================================================
00475 
00476 #if (MTOUCH_INTEGRATION_TYPE != MTOUCH_CONTROLS_ISR)
00477 void interrupt ISR(void)
00478 {
00479     // EXAMPLE INTERRUPT SERVICE ROUTINE
00480     //
00481     // If MTOUCH_INTEGRATION_TYPE is defined as MTOUCH_CONTROLS_ISR, the framework will implement 
00482     // a dedicated ISR for the mTouch scans' use. If it is not defined, the application may implement 
00483     // its own ISR. 
00484     //
00485     // A few rules must be followed by custom ISR functions:
00486     //
00487     // 1. If MTOUCH_INTEGRATION_TYPE is defined as MTOUCH_CALLED_FROM_MAINLOOP, you must set 
00488     //    mTouch_state.isrServiced each time you enter the ISR. This tells the framework that the scan 
00489     //    was interrupted and needs to be repeated.
00490     //
00491     // 2. If MTOUCH_INTEGRATION_TYPE is defined as MTOUCH_CALLED_FROM_ISR, the example API usage below 
00492     //    is required to service mTouch scanning.
00493 
00494     #if defined(MCOMM_ENABLED) && defined(MCOMM_TWO_WAY_ENABLED)  
00495         // If the V2 comms have been enabled, we need to receive incoming requests.
00496         #if     (MCOMM_TYPE == MCOMM_UART_TWO_WAY)
00497         if (MCOMM_UART_RCIE && MCOMM_UART_RCIF)     // Check UART for new data
00498         #elif   (MCOMM_TYPE == MCOMM_I2C_TWO_WAY)
00499         if (MCOMM_I2C_SSPIE && MCOMM_I2C_SSPIF)      // Check I2C for new data
00500         #elif   (MCOMM_TYPE == MCOMM_SPI_TWO_WAY)
00501         if (MCOMM_SPI_SSPIE && MCOMM_SPI_SSPIF)      // Check SPI for new data
00502         #endif
00503         {
00504             mComm_Receive();            // Two-way Communication Receive Service Function
00505         }        
00506     #endif  
00507     
00508     
00509     #if (MTOUCH_INTEGRATION_TYPE == MTOUCH_CALLED_FROM_ISR)
00510         if (mTouch_checkInterrupt())    // Checks if the TMRxIE and TMRxIF flags are both equal to 1.
00511         {
00512             mTouch_Scan();              // Required if running as ISR slave. The mTouch timer interrupt 
00513                                         // flag is cleared inside the mTouch_Scan() function.
00514         }
00515     #elif (MTOUCH_INTEGRATION_TYPE == MTOUCH_CALLED_FROM_MAINLOOP)
00516         mTouch_state.isrServiced = 1;   // Alerts the mTouch scanning routine that an interrupt may 
00517                                         // have disrupted a scan. This is cleared at the start of a
00518                                         // new scan and is checked at the end of the scan.
00519                                         // Bad data can affect the readings if this flag is not set.
00520     #endif
00521 
00522 }
00523 #endif
00524
